definition[0]: to stop someone from doing something, often by using physical force
example[0]: I had to restrain her from running out into the street.
example[1]: He had to be restrained from using violence.
definition[1]: to control your own emotions or behaviour
example[2]: Renwick restrained a feeling of annoyance.
example[3]: She could barely restrain herself from hitting him.
definition[2]: to control or limit something that is increasing too much
example[4]: Price rises should restrain consumer spending.
definition[3]: to control or limit something that is starting to increase
example[5]: tough rules to restrain the creation of monopolies
example[6]: A cut in consumer credit would restrain an economic recovery.
